Hello

I have a problem. I'm trying to write an elegant unit test that comp=
ares two Array's of Doubles. Obviously these values are unlikly to be the s=
ame and to add another aspect, some of them can be NaN's. My current soluti=
on is

for(int i=3D0; i< result.length; i++)
{
	if(expected[i].isNaN())
	{
=
		assertThat(result[i], is(Double.NaN));
	}
	else
	{
		assertThat(result[i]=
, closeTo(expected[i],1E-14));
	}

}

What I would really like to do is

as=
sertThat(result, closeTo(expected,1E-14))

This means that the closeTo Matc=
her must understand Arrays and must process NaN's correctly (i.e. NaN =3D=
=3D NaN returns true)

Does anyone know if this is possible. I hanven't got=
 that much experience using hamcrest assertions so excuse me if it's obviou=
s.
